title: Strange concretization behavior with --test=all

labels.name: concretizer-use-case
labels.description: interesting dependency hierarchy that would challenge the current concretizer

body:
If I install a package with `--test=all`, I see some very strange concretization behavior. For example, `spack install --test=all py-attrs`, which might have a circular test dependency on itself, tries to build `py-attrs` before building `python`, and crashes due to a missing attribute that is normally defined by the `PythonPackage` base class. See below for full error message.

### Spack version

```console
$ spack --version
0.14.0-149-6412b9e71a
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install --test=all py-attrs
```
Note that this error does not occur for `--test=root`. I'm not sure if this error exists for other packages or just packages with circular test dependencies.

As you can see, it builds some of the Python dependencies, but not Python itself. Because `python` is not a dependency of `py-attrs` (during testing), `self.python(...)` crashes.

### Information on your system

macOS 10.15.3
Python 3.7.6

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
